lead_paragraph: The pole-sitter Dario Franchitti led all but eight laps and held off Scott Dixon and Dan Wheldon with the help of a late caution last night for his first IndyCar Series victory at Richmond.Franchitti, whose position atop the point standings gave him the top starting spot when Friday night’s qualifying was rained out, gave up the lead only twice, and even then it was during pit stops under caution. His victory was sealed when a late caution allowed him to conserve fuel, and he pulled away with ease on a restart with six laps to go.
